author: Terry Draper

review: This new, tiny thingy seems to do everything the larger, more expensive Roku 3 can do. Got both, along with a Roku 2, which has only one flaw -- doesn't get YouTube. Interesting marketing by Roku -- a product that costs about half of his most recent full-size product but seems to be indistinguishable in performance. The only pbm so far is that not all smaller-screen HDTVs have limited space for a USB-sized device being plugged into the back. I simply changed out some TVs, but something to at least know about.
author: RodLefty

review: Years ago I bought the first Roku box for $99 and have been a convert ever since.  When I found out about the streaming stick for only $50, I immediately pre-ordered it.  It's great.  The navigation interface is much better than my old Roku box and the channels seem limitless, although I stick to about 10.  My first Roku still works, so I just put it on my upstairs television so I can enjoy my Netflix on both my TVs.  Thus, I am confident that Roku's products are built to last and adapt with the times.  If you have not cut the cable cord yet, let this little stick be your motivation.
